intro: Memecylon tricolor var. longipes, commonly known as the three-colored memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically green with red or purple veins. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. This varietal form is distinguished by its elongated pedicels, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
